    level="1"
    right="Item 5"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Metronomic Hammer](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1595)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Outlaws of Alkenstar</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #179: Cradle of Quartz](/Sources.aspx?ID=122) pg. 79

**Price** 160 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 or 2 hands

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Weapon** [Gnome Hooked Hammer](/Weapons.aspx?ID=52)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A polished brass metronome ticks rhythmically within the haft of this _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [gnome hooked hammer](/Weapons.aspx?ID=52)_. Gnome adherents of [Brigh](/Deities.aspx?ID=33) often attempt to reproduce this item as part of a ritual symbolizing methodical problem-solving and thoughtful craftsmanship.

**Activate** <actions string="Reaction" /> envision;   **Trigger** You attempt to [Trip](/Actions.aspx?ID=40) a creature with the _metronomic hammer_;  **Effect** By timing the sweeping arcs of your Trip attempt to the built-in metronome of a _metronomic hammer_, you gain a +1 item bonus to your [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check to Trip the target. This item bonus increases by 1 with every subsequent Trip attempt you make with the _metronomic hammer_ against the same target this turn, to a maximum of +3 on your third Trip. The bonus resets to +1 if you successfully Trip the target, if you critically fail to Trip the target, or if your turn ends.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
